section.title: Package Managers
section.para: So far, three processors implement the current state of the packaging proposal. The eXist database, the Saxon XSLT and XQuery processor and the Calabash XProc processor. The support in eXist is official (part of the current eXist trunk, which should be released as eXist 1.6 in the last quarter of 2010). The support in Saxon and Calabash as been implemented as a third-party project; see the project home for all details and downloads.

All those three implementations rely on the same underlying repository structure, and actually all use the same repository manager written in Java as part of the above mentioned expath-pkg project. They also all support packaging extension functions written in Java (for Saxon and eXist, but Calabash can configure its underlying Saxon processor as well).

The expath-pkg project also provides a repository manager, called xrepo, to help managing packages in a repository (installing, removing, listing, etc.) The same implementations are also used in Servlex, the framework used to run the EXPath website, based exclusively on XML technologies.
